author: The Editorial Board
title: Happy Bipartisan Budget Blowout Day
text:
The U.S. House passed its giant spending bill on Thursday, fewer than 24 hours after leaders unveiled its 2,232 pages. This is no way to run a government. And as expected, the price Republicans are paying for restoring the military is a blowout for domestic accounts, which won’t be remembered as the GOP’s finest hour.

The $1.3 trillion bill is the last barge moving through Congress for a while, so Members loaded everything possible onto the legislation, from opioid funding to dollars for transportation. Some of the hoarier...
